downloadDescription: This page includes links to the documents that contain installation instructions for the various components of Microsoft Dynamics GP 2010.
detailsSection:
You can use this page to download the following guides that include installation information:
  • Analysis Cubes (Microsoft SQL Server 2005 and 2008) (AnalysisCubes.pdf): Explains how to install, set up, and use Analysis Cubes, which you can view and customize to analyze your Microsoft Dynamics GP data. Also describes the dimensions, attributes, and measures of the cubes, and explains how to create Excel worksheets with PivotTable reports using the cubes.
  • Audit Trails (AuditTrails.pdf): Explains how to install, upgrade, set up, and use Audit Trails to track change history on any data changes that occur within Microsoft Dynamics GP. Audit Trails helps support compliance with regulations for how you secure, manage, and control your business data, such as Sarbanes-Oxley and FDA 21 CFR Part 11.
  • Business Analyzer (BusinessAnalyzer.pdf): Describes how to install and set up Business Analyzer to access reports from your desktop.
  • Business Portal Installation Instructions (Release 5.0) (BusinessPortalInstallation50.pdf): Explains how to install Business Portal on a web server running either Windows SharePoint Services or Microsoft Office SharePoint Server. Includes maintenance and troubleshooting information, and also describes how to set up Business Portal for extranet access.
  • Business Portal Installation Instructions (Release 5.1) (BusinessPortalInstallation51.pdf): Explains how to install Business Portal on a Web server running either Windows SharePoint Foundation or Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010. Includes maintenance and troubleshooting information, and also describes how to set up Business Portal for extranet access.
  • Electronic Signatures (ElectronicSignatures.pdf): Describes how to install, set up, and use Electronic Signatures to enable authorizations for system changes and attach reason codes and comments to change history. Electronic Signatures helps you meet the requirements of data compliance regulations such as FDA 21 CFR Part 11 and the Sarbanes-Oxley Act.
  • GDPdU Data Export (GDPDU.pdf): Describes how to install and then use GDPdU Data Export to extract tax-related data from Microsoft Dynamics GP. In Germany, this data is sent to an auditor before the final report is submitted to the tax authorities.
  • GST and Australian Taxes (GSTandAustralianTaxes.pdf): Explains how to install the Australian tax features, and set up and use Goods and Services Tax (GST), Pay As You Go, Business Activity Statement reports, and Pay As You Go reports. Also describes how to enter and view tax information.
  • Human Resources and Payroll Suite for Business Portal Installation Guide (BPHRPSuiteInstallation.pdf): Describes how to install the Human Resources and Payroll Suite, which includes Benefit Self-Service and Certification, Training, and Licensing Manager.
  • Microsoft Dynamics GP 2010 Installation Instructions (Installation.pdf): Contains the installation checklist and instructions for installing Microsoft Dynamics GP and its additional products. Also explains how to set up a company and an account framework.
  • Personal Data Keeper (PDK.pdf): Explains how to install, upgrade, and set up Personal Data Keeper, which you can use to enter and submit Project Accounting timesheets and expense reports, regardless of whether you're connected to the corporate network. Also describes how to enter transactions and complete inquiry and reporting procedures.
  • Professional Services Tools Library (ProfServicesToolsLibrary.pdf): Explains how to install and use the Professional Services Tools Library, and includes descriptions of the tools available for each series.
  • Web Services Installation and Administration Guide (WSInstallAdminGuide.pdf): Explains how to install, administer, and run the web services so they can be used by applications that integrate with Microsoft Dynamics GP. Also explains how to manage security for the web services.
  • Workflow Installation and Upgrade Guide (WorkflowInstallation.pdf): Explains how to install Workflow components on a web server running Windows SharePoint Services or Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007. Also describes how to upgrade Workflow for Microsoft Dynamics GP 10.0 on Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 to Workflow for Microsoft Dynamics GP 2010 on Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007.
systemRequirementsSection: • To view the PDF file, you will need a PDF reader, such as the free Adobe Reader.
installInstructionSection:
1. Click Download to download the manuals in PDF file format.
  2. Save the files to your computer. When prompted for a location for the files, save them to the Documentation folder in your Microsoft Dynamics GP 2010 or Business Portal installation folder. By default, this is C:\Program Files\Microsoft Dynamics\GP2010\Documentation for Microsoft Dynamics GP and C:\Program Files\Microsoft Dynamics\Business Portal\Documentation for Business Portal.
  3. If you’re asked if you want to overwrite the existing files, click Yes. You might need to remove the release number (50 or 51) from some of the file names to overwrite the existing files.
  4. Repeat these steps on each computer where you want to install the manuals, or save the files to a shared folder where other others can access them.
